modules.description: Performs pattern-based string manipulation including repetition of strings a specified number of times. Works directly with integers and strings, ensuring precise control over repetition counts. Useful for generating repeated string sequences like padding, delimiters, or fixed-length markers in text processing tasks.

This module defines commonly used string constants for character sets including digits, hexadecimal and octal characters, whitespace, and alphabetic characters in various cases. These values provide ready-to-use character collections for parsing, validation, and generation tasks. For example, `hex_digits` can be used to validate hexadecimal input, while `whitespace` is useful for trimming or splitting strings based on whitespace characters.

This module supports transforming and analyzing string casing using US-ASCII character rules, offering operations like case conversion (uppercase, lowercase, camel/snake/title case), positional capitalization, and case swapping. It provides predicates to check case properties (e.g., `is_lowercase`) and handles edge cases in string manipulation, enabling tasks like standardizing identifiers, validating input formats, or normalizing text data. Key use cases include code generation requiring specific naming conventions and preprocessing strings for consistent representation.

This module offers precise string manipulation through case transformation, pattern-based operations, and predefined character sets. It supports functions for case analysis and conversion, string repetition, and validation against common character types. Directly works with strings and integers to handle tasks like identifier normalization, text padding, and input validation.
